intro: Pinckneya, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. It consists of a single species, Pinckneya ovata, which is native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Pinckneya is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
